author: fwyzard
body:
#### PR description:

This is a work in progress:
  - the tests run but produce some CUDA-related errors during the destruction
  - the CPU workflow is inefficient with an extra memory copy
  - the use of beginStream() needs to be understood and removed


#### PR validation:

The unit test pass, even though the `writer.py` test produces the errors:
```
/data/user/fwyzard/CMSSW_12_5_0_pre4/alpaka/include/alpaka/event/EventUniformCudaHipRt.hpp(75) 'TApi::eventDestroy(m_UniformCudaHipEvent)' returned error  : 'cudaErrorContextIsDestroyed': 'context is destroyed'!
/data/user/fwyzard/CMSSW_12_5_0_pre4/alpaka/include/alpaka/event/EventUniformCudaHipRt.hpp(75) 'TApi::eventDestroy(m_UniformCudaHipEvent)' A previous API call (not this one) set the error  : 'cudaErrorInvalidValue': 'invalid argument'!
/data/user/fwyzard/CMSSW_12_5_0_pre4/alpaka/include/alpaka/event/EventUniformCudaHipRt.hpp(75) 'TApi::eventDestroy(m_UniformCudaHipEvent)' returned error  : 'cudaErrorContextIsDestroyed': 'context is destroyed'!
/data/user/fwyzard/CMSSW_12_5_0_pre4/alpaka/include/alpaka/queue/cuda_hip/QueueUniformCudaHipRt.hpp(81) 'TApi::streamDestroy(m_UniformCudaHipQueue)' returned error  : 'cudaErrorInvalidResourceHandle': 'invalid resource handle'!
```
title: Implement the alpaka-based accelerator framework for CMSSW
